requirement_tested: Create new to-do items with title and description fields
user_persona: A busy professional who needs to quickly jot down tasks.
user_goal: To add a new task with both title and description to their to-do list.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Task Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the app and sees the new task form. She types 'Prepare presentation' into the title field and adds 'Create slides for Q3 review meeting' in the description area.
narrative_steps.action: Enter text into the title input field and description text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The title and description fields update with her input. The submit button becomes enabled.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the New Task
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with her entries, Sarah presses Enter in the title field to submit the form quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter key in the title input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new task titled 'Prepare presentation' appears in the task list with the correct description. The form fields are cleared.

requirement_tested: Edit existing to-do items including title and description
user_persona: A project manager reviewing team tasks.
user_goal: To correct a typo in an existing task's title and enhance its description.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Edit Mode
narrative_steps.description: Alex notices a typo in the task 'Prepeare report'. He clicks the edit icon next to the task to make changes.
narrative_steps.action: Click the edit icon on the task card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task transforms into an editable form with pre-filled title and description fields.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Task Information
narrative_steps.description: Alex corrects the title to 'Prepare report' and expands the description to include more details about required data sources.
narrative_steps.action: Modify text in the title input field and description text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The fields reflect Alex's updated text.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Changes
narrative_steps.description: After making corrections, Alex clicks the save button to apply his changes.
narrative_steps.action: Click the save button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task reverts to display mode showing the corrected title and enhanced description. The task list remains intact.

user_persona: A student cleaning up old assignment reminders.
user_goal: To remove an outdated task from their to-do list.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Unwanted Task
narrative_steps.description: Jamie sees the task 'Submit Math Homework - Due Jan 15' which was already submitted last month. She decides to delete it.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the unwanted task in the list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is visible with its delete icon button on the right side.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting the Task
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks the delete icon to remove the outdated task.
narrative_steps.action: Click the delete icon button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task immediately disappears from the list without any confirmation dialog. The task count updates accordingly.

requirement_tested: Mark to-do items as completed with visual indication
user_persona: A freelancer tracking daily work progress.
user_goal: To mark a completed client task as finished in the system.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Task to Complete
narrative_steps.description: Taylor has finished 'Send draft proposal to client' and wants to mark it as done. She identifies the task in her list.
narrative_steps.action: Find the task in the list view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is displayed with an unchecked checkbox on the left side.

narrative_steps.title: Marking Task as Completed
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the checkbox next to the task to indicate completion.
narrative_steps.action: Click the checkbox for the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The checkbox becomes checked, the task title gets a strike-through effect, and the text color lightens. The task count reflects one more completed task.

requirement_tested: Filter to-do items by status (all, active, completed)
user_persona: A team leader preparing for a weekly progress meeting.
user_goal: To view only completed tasks to discuss accomplishments during the meeting.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Filter Controls
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the to-do app and looks at the filter options above the task list to focus on completed items.
narrative_steps.action: View the filter buttons ('All', 'Active', 'Completed').
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All three filter buttons are visible with consistent styling.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Completed Filter
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks the 'Completed' button to hide all pending tasks and see only finished work.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Completed' filter button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only completed tasks are displayed in the list. The 'Completed' button appears visually highlighted to indicate it's active.

requirement_tested: Search to-do items by keyword across title and description
user_persona: A researcher looking for specific project-related tasks.
user_goal: To find all tasks related to 'budget' preparation among many existing tasks.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Search
narrative_steps.description: Casey remembers having created several budget-related tasks but can't recall their exact titles. She decides to use the search function.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the search input field above the task list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A search box with a magnifying glass icon is visible.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Search Term
narrative_steps.description: Casey types 'budget' into the search field to find relevant tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'budget' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task list dynamically updates to show only tasks whose title or description contains 'budget'.

requirement_tested: Browse all to-do items in a list view
user_persona: A new user exploring the application for the first time.
user_goal: To understand how their tasks are organized and presented.

narrative_steps.title: Opening the Application
narrative_steps.description: Riley launches the to-do app for the first time after installation to see how tasks are displayed.
narrative_steps.action: Open the application in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The application loads with a lavender background and indigo-styled components.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Task Collection
narrative_steps.description: Riley scrolls through the main area to examine how existing tasks are arranged.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the task list view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tasks appear in a vertically stacked list with consistent spacing, indigo borders, and lavender background on each task card.

requirement_tested: Display to-do items with clear visual distinction between completed and active tasks
user_persona: A productivity enthusiast who values visual organization.
user_goal: To quickly identify which tasks still need attention at a glance.

narrative_steps.title: Scanning Task List
narrative_steps.description: Jordan reviews their to-do list and wants to distinguish between pending and finished tasks instantly.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the task list containing both active and completed tasks.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Active tasks display with bold text and solid indigo left border, while completed tasks show strike-through text, lighter font color, and dashed indigo left border.

requirement_tested: Provide a text input field for entering new task titles
user_persona: A quick note-taker who captures ideas on the go.
user_goal: To rapidly capture a new task idea with just a title.

narrative_steps.title: Starting New Task Entry
narrative_steps.description: Casey has a sudden idea for a task and rushes to enter it before forgetting. She focuses on the title input field.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the task title input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The cursor appears in the input field with placeholder 'Enter task title'.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Task Title
narrative_steps.description: Casey types 'Buy groceries' into the title field and notices the submit button becoming active.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Buy groceries' into the title input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The input field shows 'Buy groceries' and the submit button becomes enabled.

requirement_tested: Include a text area for detailed task descriptions
user_persona: A meticulous planner who likes to add context to every task.
user_goal: To provide comprehensive details for a complex task.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Task Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex wants to add extensive notes to a task about organizing the company retreat. He moves to the description area.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the task description text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The text area becomes focused with placeholder 'Enter task description'.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Detailed Description
narrative_steps.description: Alex begins typing detailed instructions about venue selection, guest list management, and catering preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Type multiple lines of text into the description area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The text area expands vertically to accommodate the content, showing all typed information clearly.

requirement_tested: Show a counter displaying total and completed task counts
user_persona: A goal-oriented individual tracking productivity metrics.
user_goal: To monitor overall task completion progress throughout the day.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Initial Status
narrative_steps.description: Taylor starts their workday and checks the task counter to see how much work awaits.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the status bar below the controls.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The counter displays the total number of tasks and how many are completed (e.g., '12 tasks total, 3 completed').

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Progress After Completion
narrative_steps.description: After finishing a task, Taylor glances at the counter again to see updated progress.
narrative_steps.action: Complete a task by clicking its checkbox.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The counter automatically updates to reflect one additional completed task (e.g., '12 tasks total, 4 completed').

requirement_tested: Implement a clean and intuitive user interface
user_persona: A non-technical user trying a new productivity tool.
user_goal: To navigate and use the application without confusion or difficulty.

narrative_steps.title: First Impressions
narrative_steps.description: Robin opens the app for the first time and assesses whether the interface feels approachable.
narrative_steps.action: Load the application homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout presents clear visual hierarchy with consistent spacing, typography, and alignment. Interactive elements are easily identifiable.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Interactive Feedback
narrative_steps.description: Robin hovers over various buttons to see if they respond appropriately to interaction.
narrative_steps.action: Hover mouse over different buttons and interactive elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Buttons and interactive elements subtly darken in indigo color, providing clear visual feedback for hover states.

requirement_tested: Apply lavender background color to all application pages
user_persona: A designer checking visual consistency across the application.
user_goal: To verify that the entire application maintains a uniform lavender background theme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Main Viewport
narrative_steps.description: Dana examines the primary application screen to confirm background color implementation.
narrative_steps.action: View the main application page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire viewport displays a solid lavender background color (#E6E6FA).

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Dana inspects individual components like forms and task cards to ensure they maintain the lavender background.
narrative_steps.action: Examine various UI components throughout the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All components consistently maintain the lavender background with indigo-styled elements.

requirement_tested: Style all UI components with indigo color scheme
user_persona: A brand compliance officer auditing application styling.
user_goal: To ensure all interactive elements and borders use the specified indigo color palette.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Button Styling
narrative_steps.description: Patricia checks that all buttons follow the indigo color scheme as per brand guidelines.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect various buttons throughout the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons use various shades of indigo (#4B0082 to #9370DB) for consistent color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Border Colors
narrative_steps.description: Patricia examines form fields and task cards to confirm indigo border usage.
narrative_steps.action: Check borders on input fields, text areas, and task cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Borders on all interactive elements and containers use appropriate indigo color variations.

requirement_tested: Ensure responsive design for different screen sizes
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the application on their phone.
user_goal: To effectively use the to-do list application on a small touchscreen device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Jordan opens the to-do app on their smartphone to add a quick task while commuting.
narrative_steps.action: Load the application on a mobile device or resize browser to mobile width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts fluidly to mobile view with vertically stacked elements, readable text sizes, and adequately sized touch targets.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Responsive Elements
narrative_steps.description: Jordan taps on the new task form and verifies that all elements are properly sized for touch interaction.
narrative_steps.action: Tap on various interactive elements like input fields and buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Component widths adjust proportionally, text remains readable, and touch targets are appropriately large for easy interaction.
